comments.content: Not an exact match, but you can achieve a similar result by emboldening/compressing **[Smart Sans (Bold)](http://web.archive.org/web/20150413075126/http:/www.findmyfont.com/index.php/fonts/font-preview?fset=Monotype&ffam=Smart%20Sans%20Std%20-%20Bold&fid=33446f8fd4f7b727d43e333309bfbe33&fstyle=b&fsize=60&text=AKIRA&fit=1)** by Rod McDonald (Monotype, 2004)

[Previous discussion](http://web.archive.org/web/20150413075126/http:/typophile.com/node/101734) on this topic.

> Don't think it's a font as it, more a custom work based on some existing type or why not a hand-lettering by Otomo Katsuhiro himself mimicking some black condensed grotesk. If I had to reproduce it, I'd probably start with [Impact](http://web.archive.org/web/20150413075126/http:/www.myfonts.com/search/Impact), stretching it and pulling some points up/downwards to reduce bowlers. [Tasse](http://web.archive.org/web/20150413075126/http:/www.myfonts.com/fonts/fontbureau/tasse) would be another good substitute.
